ground_truth.neutralization_reason: Mutex lock prevents recursive calls during execution

notes: The currentTokenSupply() at lines 249-251 returns IERC20.totalSupply() directly. For tokens where supply can be atomically manipulated (flash-mintable, ERC4626 shares), attackers can inflate/deflate supply during threshold calculations. This allows gaming the participation and approval requirements, especially on the last block of voting.

gold_standard_fields.source_report: Aragon DAO Gov Plugin Security Review
gold_standard_fields.finding_title: currentTokenSupply() can be gamed risk-free to manipulate either side of votes in certain assets
gold_standard_fields.call_flow: Attacker.flashMint() -> totalSupply increases -> proposal.execute() -> MajorityVotingBase._hasSucceeded() -> isMinVotingPowerReached() -> currentTokenSupply() returns inflated value -> participation check fails -> Attacker.flashBurn()

evaluation_support.original_finding_title: currentTokenSupply() can be gamed risk-free to manipulate either side of votes in certain assets
